TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DateFormat extends Java.Text._Format

Docs.summary: Formats or parses dates and times.

remarks.para: Formats or parses dates and times.

This class provides factories for obtaining instances configured for a specific locale. The most common subclass is .
Sample Code

Produces this output when run on an en_US device in the America/Los_Angeles time zone:
Dec 31, 1969 Jan 1, 1970 Dec 31, 1969 4:00:00 PM Jan 1, 1970 12:00:00 AM 4:00:00 PM 12:00:00 AM
And will produce similarly appropriate localized human-readable output on any user's system. Notice how the same point in time when formatted can appear to be a different time when rendered for a different time zone. This is one reason why formatting should be left until the data will only be presented to a human. Machines should interchange "Unix time" integers.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed Java.Lang.StringBuffer Format (Java.Lang.Object object, Java.Lang.StringBuffer buffer, Java.Text.FieldPosition field);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Lang.StringBuffer Format(class Java.Lang.Object object, class Java.Lang.StringBuffer buffer, class Java.Text.FieldPosition field) cil managed

Docs.param: the source object to format, must be a Date or a Number. If object is a number then a date is constructed using the longValue() of the number.
the target string buffer to append the formatted date/time to.
on input: an optional alignment field; on output: the offsets of the alignment field in the formatted text.
Docs.summary: Formats the specified object as a string using the pattern of this date format and appends the string to the specified string buffer.

remarks.para: Formats the specified object as a string using the pattern of this date format and appends the string to the specified string buffer.

If the field member of field contains a value specifying a format field, then its beginIndex and endIndex members will be updated with the position of the first occurrence of this field in the formatted text.

Docs.exception: if object is neither a Date nor a Number instance.

Docs.summary: The FieldPosition selector for 'H' field alignment, corresponds to the field.

remarks.para: The FieldPosition selector for 'H' field alignment, corresponds to the field. HOUR_OF_DAY0_FIELD is used for the zero-based 24-hour clock. For example, 23:59 + 01:00 results in 00:59.

Docs.summary: The FieldPosition selector for 'k' field alignment, corresponds to the field.

remarks.para: The FieldPosition selector for 'k' field alignment, corresponds to the field. HOUR_OF_DAY1_FIELD is used for the one-based 24-hour clock. For example, 23:59 + 01:00 results in 24:59.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Lenient { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the calendar used by this date format is lenient.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Indicates whether the calendar used by this date format is lenient.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Specifies whether or not date/time parsing shall be lenient. With lenient parsing, the parser may use heuristics to interpret inputs that do not precisely match this object's format. With strict parsing, inputs must match this object's format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Util.Date Parse(string string) cil managed

Docs.param: the string to parse.
Docs.summary: Parses a date from the specified string using the rules of this date format.

remarks.para: Parses a date from the specified string using the rules of this date format.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs during parsing.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Util.Date Parse (string string, Java.Text.ParsePosition position);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Util.Date Parse(string string, class Java.Text.ParsePosition position) cil managed

Docs.param: the string to parse.

input/output parameter, specifies the start index in string from where to start parsing. If parsing is successful, it is updated with the index following the parsed text; on error, the index is unchanged and the error index is set to the index where the error occurred.
Docs.summary: Parses a date from the specified string starting at the index specified by position.

remarks.para: Parses a date from the specified string starting at the index specified by position. If the string is successfully parsed then the index of the ParsePosition is updated to the index following the parsed text. On error, the index is unchanged and the error index of ParsePosition is set to the index where the error occurred.

By default, parsing is lenient: If the input is not in the form used by this object's format method but can still be parsed as a date, then the parse succeeds. Clients may insist on strict adherence to the format by calling setLenient(false).

MemberSignature.Value: public override Java.Lang.Object ParseObject (string string, Java.Text.ParsePosition position);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Lang.Object ParseObject(string string, class Java.Text.ParsePosition position) cil managed

Docs.param: the string to parse.

input/output parameter, specifies the start index in string from where to start parsing. If parsing is successful, it is updated with the index following the parsed text; on error, the index is unchanged and the error index is set to the index where the error occurred.
Docs.summary: Parses a date from the specified string starting at the index specified by position.

remarks.para: Parses a date from the specified string starting at the index specified by position. If the string is successfully parsed then the index of the ParsePosition is updated to the index following the parsed text. On error, the index is unchanged and the error index of ParsePosition is set to the index where the error occurred.

By default, parsing is lenient: If the input is not in the form used by this object's format method but can still be parsed as a date, then the parse succeeds. Clients may insist on strict adherence to the format by calling setLenient(false).

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
